Package ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict

Interface WordList

All Known Subinterfaces:
RankedList
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWordList, BucketList, TernaryTreeList
public interface WordList
WordList is implemented by classes that can represent a dictionary of correctly spelled words for a spell checker.

  • Method Details

    • add

      void add​(String word)
      Adds a new word to the list.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to add
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the word is null

    • addAll

      void addAll​(String[] words)
      Adds all the words in an array to the list.
      Parameters:
      words - words to add to the list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the array or any of its elements is null

    • contains

      boolean contains​(String word)
      Returns true if word is in the word list.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to search for
      Returns:
      true if the word is in the list, else false

    • clear

      void clear()
      Removes all words from this list.

    • getFrequencyRank

      int getFrequencyRank​(String word)
      Returns the frequency rank of word if this list has frequency data and the word is contained in the list.Otherwise returns -1. The frequency rank is a number between RANK_MINIMUM and RANK_MAXIMUM inclusive that indicates how commonly a word is used in typical text, with 0 being the most frequent.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to look up a rank for
      Returns:
      the frequency rank of the word or -1

    • hasFrequencyRanks

      boolean hasFrequencyRanks()
      Returns true if this list contains the data needed to provide frequency rank information. Even if a particular list type supports frequency ranks, a particular instance may not have this data available.
      Returns:
      true if frequency rank data is available for this word list

    • getSuggestions

      Suggestion[] getSuggestions​(WordPolicy policy, String badWord, int d, int limit)
      Returns suggested replacements for a misspelled word, sorted by increasing order of relevance.
      Parameters:
      policy - a policy used to improve the quality of the results (may be null)
      badWord - the word to find replacements for
      d - the maximum edit distance to search, or -1 to use the default value
      limit - the maximum number of suggestions to return; no limit if < 1
      Returns:
      at most limit suggestions, sorted from most to least likely

    • getWordCount

      int getWordCount()
      Returns the number of unique words in the list. Depending on the implementation, this may not be available in constant time.
      Returns:
      the number of words in the list

    • getWords

      List<String> getWords()
      Returns the words contained in this list. The words are not listed in any particular order.
      Returns:
      a list of words for which contains(java.lang.String) would return true

    • write

      void write​(File f, int optLevel) throws IOException
      Writes the list to a file. The format of the list depends on the specific list implementation.
      Parameters:
      f - the file to write to
      optLevel - an optimization hint between 0 and 9 that suggests how hard the writer should try to reduce the file size
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the list

    • write

      void write​(OutputStream out, int optLevel) throws IOException
      Writes the list to an output stream without closing the stream. The format of the list depends on the specific list implementation. The optLevel parameter controls the time/space tradeoff between write time and file size. The value must be between 0 (no optimization) and 9 (smallest file size) inclusive. (Depending on the implementation, this parameter may or may not have an effect. See the documentation for the specific class.)
      Parameters:
      out - the stream to write to
      optLevel - an optimization hint between 0 and 9 that suggests how hard the writer should try to reduce the file size
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the list

    • read

      void read​(File f) throws IOException
      Reads a list that was previously written with write(java.io.File, int) from a file.
      Parameters:
      f - the file to read from
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the list
      NullPointerException - if the file is null

    • read

      void read​(InputStream in) throws IOException
      Reads a list that was previously written with write(java.io.File, int) from a stream.
      Parameters:
      in - the input stream to read from
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the list
      NullPointerException - if the input stream is null
